 The game states. The game state can be changed with setGameState, pushState and popState.

Detailed Description

Game base class. Any game using this engine makes an instance of an inherited Game class. This class handles the initialization of all subsystems like video, audio and so on, and it stores all the loaded resources in the resource managers. The member function onInit() needs to be inherited and implemented by the users of the engine.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void onInit (  )  [protected, pure virtual]

onInit is called after the game object has been initialized. This particular function MUST be inherited and implemented by the user of this engine.

void loadResources ( std::string  dir,
ResourceTypeEnum  resType 
) [protected]

Loads all the XML resources in the specified directory of the specified resource type. It works recursively.

Parameters:
dir The directory to load the resources from.
resType The type of resource to load. This can be any of the constants defined in the ResourceTypeEnum enumeration, defined in com_typedefs.h.

void initialize ( int  width,
int  height,
bool  fullscreen 
)

Initialize the display (screen), audio, input.

Parameters:
width Screen width.
height Screen height.
fullscreen Set to true if you want to run in fullscreen.
Exceptions:
FatalException If initialization of any of the subsystems fails, the program probably can't continue and a FatalException is thrown.

void run ( double  frameTime  ) 

Runs the game. This should be called every time the main game loop loops.

Parameters:
frameTime The amount of time used to render the last frame, in seconds.

void shutdown (  ) 

Shuts the game down. De-initializes everything and frees any used resources. Be sure to not call run() after this.

void setGameState ( GameState *  state  ) 

Removes any existing game state and sets a new one.

Parameters:
state A pointer to an derived GameState object you want to set.

void pushState ( GameState *  state  ) 

Pushes a new game state onto the stack of states. This pauses the last running state.

Parameters:
state A pointer to an derived GameState object you want to push onto the stack.

void popState (  ) 

Pops the topmost (currently running) game state. This resumes the next-topmost state, and deletes the previously topmost state.

std::string getObjectFile ( std::string  name  ) 

Returns the XML file name containing the object's properties associated with the specified name.

Parameters:
name Name of the object. The name of an object is specified in it's XML file.
Returns:
The path of the XML file containing the object data.

std::string getObjectSprite ( std::string  name  ) 

Returns the name of the sprite associated with the object with the specified name.

Parameters:
name Name of the object. The name of an object is specified in it's XML file.
Returns:
The name of the sprite associated with the object.
